div.pre: 1887 Calabria (anc. Bruttium), 1863 (182) Burial: c. 470 B.C. (K) Contents: 175 AR Taras: 15 st. (dolphin-rider/hippocamp) Laus: 1 st. (incuse) Metapontum: 14 st. (incuse) Poseidonia: 14 st. (Poseidon/bull) Sybaris: 12 st. Caulonia: 52 st. (12 incuse; 40 Apollo/stag) Croton: 66 st. (62 incuse tripod [1 rev. QΡΟ/ΤΕ]; 4 incuse eagle) Serdaei: 1 st. (Dionysus/grapes) Disposition: dispersed. BMCItaly, p. 395 (Serdaioi) possibly from this hd. Sambon, Recherches, p. 34
